What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List:
3-4 hours for each of 6 problem sets 
2-3 hours for each of 6 SAS lab assignments (can also be completed during 2hr lab instruction period)

DEFINITELY less than "2 times" that of other coursework (in reference to the 2 credits it allots)

2-3 hours for problem sets
2-3 hours for SAS lab assignments
A lot. But considering it's 2 credits. it's ok
quite a few in this accelerated course, but it was all presented very logically with excellent notes and available TA and professor.
10 hours per week
Approx 10-14

Since not all students have the same or similar backgrounds (not typically MDs or science based backgrounds), the work I needed to put into this was probably more than majority of the class.  I probably spent close to 20-25 hours per week outside of the classroom.
~10 hours
8-12 hours
4-5 hours/week for the weekly assignments
At least 10
More than 20 hours
24-30 hours per week
The course was the best taught course I've ever taken. Maria created powerpoint slides that were clear and comprehensive. You can learn from them alone.

Strengths:
- Maria is an incredibly effective educator who distills complex biostatistics concepts into their essence, even for individuals many years out from schooling
- TA Victoria Chen was incredibly prompt in grading and professional during office hours/lab.
- Both had beautifully organized powerpoints (making classroom attention nearly optional)
- Midterm was incredibly straightforward in replicating HW assignments

Weaknesses:
- NONE!!!

This course is incredibly designed. Maria is an expert in the field that is able to actually teach students that are new to the topics. She breaks down each topic in a way that is easily followed. Her slides are thorough, but only include relevant information, so they are not overwhelming. She additionally works through each type of problem step by step and then the in-class exercises supplement by asking a different point of the topic.... just really cleverly designed.

She also makes SAS extremely approachable. I like how we work with one dataset throughout the course, continuously analyzing the different variables we create.
Detailed walkthrough of content, helpful in-class exercises, extremely organized slides. Pace of class was slow at beginning and too fast at end.
Excellent
Very good overview of basic stats with excellent practice in SAS.

Class was good. The labs are largely disconnected from the homeworks/exams.  Difficult to justify to oneself the need to spend several hours on a lab that individually is only 2.5% of the final grade  - particularly when the lab formatting/technical skills aren't a focal point of the midterm or final.
Pretty straightforward statistics course. Learned most of the material in undergraduate, with the exception of ANOVA. The lab takes a little more time, but still relatively straightforwad.
It's a great biostats course and well-taught.
Challenging material but very well taught. Both the fellow and professor were very approachable

The course material and professor are exceptional. I wish I had paid better attention, but having 2 hours straight of this class was a bit much. I still learned a ton and would recommend Prof Ciareglio for any future stat classes.
excellent teacher

Its strength is its professor. Dr. Maria Ciarleglio was excellent, her instructions and her knowledge are commendable.  Her instructions are highly detailed, and the step by step solution methodology, the slides and the in class problem sets, she teaches is really the "secret sauce" to the course.  
The good thing about this course is that it covers many topics, including some that go beyond the first level Statistics, so it really provides a very strong base.  
Conversely, my criticism of this course is that it taught at a level for students who intend in doing some level of research (or would be researchers), while many of the individuals in the class are not intending to be researchers but rather administrators.  That is where the other methods of statistics would be handy such as Quantative Methods of Business Analysis (figuring out risk/reward/compensation scenarios, line queue's, etc.), these would be more helpful for healthcare business administrators.

Excellent instructor, TA. Very well designed slides and lesson plan. Complex subject was taught very carefully with examples provided for everything so there were no leaps in logic.  One of the best taught/best organized classes I've ever taken

Weakness: It is too much wokload to cover all the chapters in a text book compacted into 6 weeks along with SAS lab, Epidemiology and Social and behavioral studies which were all demanding time, long assignments and a lot of reading. Sometimes the concepts taught in biostats did not correspond to approaches for solving questions in epidemiology
Strengths: It is a good foundational course and covers biostats quickly. the slides were thorough and the teaching assistant, Victoria was also excellent and very responsive to questions. I appreciated Victoria taking extra time to go over where we made mistakes and teaching us to think through the problems patiently. The slides and the classwork sheets were very useful as well as the lab slides and exercises.

SAS labs were difficult.  I felt lost at times.  I think I became comfortable eventually, but I would have liked more baby steps so that we learned to understand SAS as a language with distinct syntax instead of just entering steps.

Strengths: I like that in-class assignments were incorporated into the lecture to help us understand new concepts. I also really enjoyed the labs taught by the TA and appreciated that application - based nature of lab assignments so we could see where/how SAS can be utilized. 
Weaknesses: The only weakness is the length of the class. I understand it's an accelerated course, but 2.5 hours is a long time so a break halfway would be helpful.
Great lecturer, TA, lecture slides. I don't think it could be improved

I am really impressed with this course. The instructor, teaching assistant, the syllabus, homeworks, exams and the lab classes were great. Only thing that forced me was the density of the classes since the time was limited. But overall, I truly enjoyed this course.

Amazing class. The inclass exercises were extremely helpful in solidifying the concepts being taught. The lecture slides were self explanatory and very useful. The class homeworks were helpful in also solidifying the material taught

the course serves as a foundation for any scientific analysis and inference. the way we finished a full book in the accelerated semester is amazing! i think it is due to the professor and the TA who made it all possible.

It was fast, but Professor Ciarleglio did a fantastic job of helping us keep up. She's clearly very knowledgeable, but more importantly is able to distill the information at the right level and is very personable.
This is a wonderful course for learning biostatistics and how to use SAS.
Balance between intro topics and advance topics is tricky as an accelerated intro course - a shorter intro would have perhaps been sufficient.
Excellent course. Very accelerated but was a helpful revision of relevant content and moved on to more advanced content in the latter half of the course.
This was an amazing course. It covered all the essential topics of biostatistics and I've already begun to incorporate what I've learned into my research practice.
Slow start but ramped up quickly and relevantly!

Strengths: Great teacher who knows her stuff and is excited about teaching the content. 
Weaknesses: Pace was too slow to begin (3 weeks on basics), and then rushed through final content, did not make it to more advanced modeling, which is what I had hoped for / expected based on the syllabus and this being a graduate level course. Unfortunately I don't feel like I'm leaving with a sufficient skillset to conduct new analyses.

Suggestion: Give students prep work over the summer and dive into where we started week 3/4 so there is more time for learning new/more advanced content/skills.
She was very at teaching complex concepts in a simple manner. She also created in-class exercises that made learning the concepts even easier.

Maria is an incredibly effective educator who distills complex biostatistics concepts into their essence, even for individuals many years out from schooling.
- intuitively organized powerpoints
- alloted sufficient time for each concept
- only wish that she taught more courses (and/or that the coursework was more involved/complex) because she communicates key concepts so clearly.
- has infectious enthusiasm for biostatistics
- Only "drawback" to her incredible organization is the fact that attention during class became "optional" because the powerpoints were so self-explanatory

Maria is the pinnacle of how teaching should be done. She designed the course so thoughtfully, that all you have to do is follow the series of lessons in order and the assignments in order, and you will be confident in your understanding.

She makes herself extremely available, and takes her time to teach valuable skills like SAS and R.
Punctual, knowledgable, flexible
Excellent teacher

Prof Ciarleglio is very organized, professional, and a wonderful instructor. Her slides and lectures follow logical patterns and she builds on material well. The in class exercises combine with the homework and labs to make frequent review of the material possible in such a short and fast paced class.
She is great. Kind and thoughtful and very responsive to students' needs.

Professor Ciarleglio went above and beyond to make sure students understood the material. Provided adequate resources to study the material. Ppts are very well created and organized. She obviously knows her subject well and answers every student question, along with framing it as a teaching moment. Very understanding and flexible due to the condensed summer schedule. Excellent professor!

Professor Ciarleglio is a wonderful instructor. She goes above and beyond; not only does she give organized, interesting lectures, she provides us with well-detailed notes that help enhance our understanding. She's very enthusiastic about teaching, and her answers to questions in class were always clear and thoughtful.
Explains things thoroughly and methodically. Has very well formulated powerpoint presentations and excellent explanation during lecture. She is very approachable with any questions or concerns.

Dr. Ciarleglio was an incredibly helpful professor. Her slides were the best I've ever seen and her grading was very generous. I also learned a lot and felt that the problem sets and exams were a very fair representation of the material we covered in class.
excellent job

Dr. Maria Ciarleglio is excellent.  Her enthusiasm is contagious.  Her slides are impeccable.  Her step by step teaching methodology and class problems are the "secret sauce" to the course.  The course material she has developed is probably the best in the industry.  I believe she has a significant amount of text book material already, and it shows she can publish at anytime she wishes to publish.

Prof Ciarleglio was the main reason the class was of such high caliber. Extremely professional, approachable, and very quick to respond to questions. Of note, slides and structure of course was top notch.
she is great

Incredibly kind.
Well organized
Passionate about her work.
Maria is a very good teacher who had great attention to detail in preparing the slides and patiently answering all the questions. I
She is a fantastic instructor, whose attention to detail is immaculate.  Her slides and organization are second to none and make it a lot easier to learn a challenging subject.

Maria is amazing. She is the superstar of the summer session professors. I enjoy that she teaches at a basic level but is very conceptual + methodical. Appreciate her willingness to answer any + all questions. Very fair assessments as well. Thank you!

I really enjoyed Maria's teaching style. Her passion for the material really shines through and helps engage the students. Maria is super organized, returns assignments back promptly, and is available for us to meet with.

She is awesome! Strengths- good pace, answers all questions, able to explain things so they make sense, very organised
No weaknesses

Professor Ciarleglio knows the subjects very well, and explain the topics very simple way even if the topic was really hard. She is patient, understanding and very technology-oriented person. She updates any changes about the class promptly. She asks the student's opinions and makes anything possible to help the students. I learned a lot, more than I have expected.
Excellent. A++

the instructor takes us all without any assumptions of prior knowledge in biostatistics or advanced maths and reaches a new height. she does not let anyone fall behind. excellent teacher and very down to earth, and approachable. we are all very privileged to have her as our instructor this summer.

I thought she was great. The course goes by fast, but it's manageable. I think that for most people in the class, the first 2 weeks were pretty simple and I think those could have been accelerated quicker (fewer slides), which would have allowed time to slow down a bit towards the end where it got more complex quickly. Highly recommend her.

Professor Ciarleglio explains even the most difficult concepts in a way you can understand. I appreciated her organization, attention to detail, and willingness to meet outside of class. I do not think her teaching can be improved; she is an amazing professor.
Maria is fantastic! Clear explanations but also lively.

Professor Ciarleglio is one of the best Professors I have ever had. She is highly approachable, explains often conceptually difficult content in a simple way and her lecture slides are always put up in advance and they are of an incredibly high standard that makes going back to the lecture to revise content relatively painless. She was also very flexible and reasonable with regard to an extension for homework assignments if we had an especially busy week which I know was greatly appreciated by the class. Thanks Professor!

The instructor was phenomenal and her passion for her subject really shined through to the entire class. She was always willing to meet and answer all of my questions. Her PowerPoint presentations were extremely thorough and truly helped me review all the topics she covered in class. Overall, she was probably the best teacher I have ever had the pleasure to learn from and I am grateful to have been in her class.
she is incredibly helpful, quick to respond, and ive never met someone so truly passionate about stats like her!

Strengths: Know your stuff, love the material, passion shows. 
Weaknesses: Sometimes too wordy in responses. Results in always being behind. Also feels repetitive (doubling down on the content is good, but felt like it slowed an already tight summer school pace)
This was a good refresher/intro for biostatistics. It's well taught and I would recommend it to anyone.

Excellent summary of basic principles of statistics, taught by outstanding instructors
Paced somewhat slowly at the start, such that it speeds up towards the end, building on earlier principles
While it was largely a review of AP Statistics and introductory statistics in college, the material was presented in a manner enhancing practical biostats applications.
100% recommend, skills learned in lab (SAS and R) will be invaluable
Great intro to biostats! Would definitely recommend
na
It's a very helpful overview of biostatistics presented in a logical way. It's a lot of work but it's very practical for those who hope to analyze their own data in the future.
If one has a good statistics background (AP stats, college stats), this class should be relatively straightforward. SAS lab takes some time getting used to, but again, nothing too difficult.
Great biostats course; you get a lot out of it.
Very well taught, excellent professor and teaching fellow. I would definitely recommend it to another student.
I would absolutely recommend this course to someone who doesn't have a stats background or could use a refresh on their stats background.
well taught

This is an excellent course for anyone interested in public health, I really enjoyed it.  The good thing about this course is that it covers many topics, including some that go beyond the first level Statistics, so it really provides a very strong base.  

Conversely, my criticism of this course is that it taught at a level for students who intend in doing some level of research (or would be researchers), while many of the individuals in the class are not intending to be researchers but rather administrators.  That is where the other methods of statistics would be handy such as Quantative Methods of Business Analysis (figuring out risk/reward/compensation/cost & benefit scenarios, line queue's, etc.), these would be more helpful for healthcare administrators.  

My other potential criticism of this course is that although majority of the students will do well in taking this course, some of us who are non-science will not do as well, so although I really liked this course a lot, I do not want my grades/passing to suffer so much because this course is really intended to challenge students with science based backgrounds. If Yale wants to produce the senior leaders of tomorrow, my suggestion at this juncture would be to try to gear this course more toward healthcare administrators. 

Note: From my experience, one of the hardest things for a healthcare leaders is to figure out (from a statistical strategic perspective) whether: (I) a merger or acquisition will work out well; or (ii) whether litigating or settling a conflict is preferred, or whether to use product A versus product B for a particular type of procedure given their cost, benefits and risks, or (iii) whether to add a wing to the hospital for specific purposes like neonatal unit or whether to change a wing in a hospital from being preventative medicine based to being more cancer or more orthopedic issues based; (iv) whether to build a hospital in a certain area given the population and demographics, (v) the impact on healthcare costs and benefit of a change in policy or law, etc.  That is something all senior healthcare administrators need to understand better and be able to strategize to lead the organizations. Most administrators do not have a comprehensive understanding of these issues, although I think they are relatively easy to teach. 

Please note, I offer the above suggestions with two things in mind:  this is only my first semester at Yale, so I don't really know the depth and breadth of what lies ahead till I take more courses; and conversely, I join this program after having many years of business and law experience and I do believe I have an idea of what the future leaders in healthcare need.

Accelerated biostatistics (esp when paired with programming) can be a conceptually difficult concept but if taken with Prof Ciarleglio would highly recommend taking  for a strong clear foundation of its principles.
Recommend
Yes.  It is a well taught course that introduces a core subject.
Excellent, basic biostats review.

This course is a great introduction and overview to the field of biostats. I would definitely recommend this class taught by this professor because it will give students an opportunity to thoroughly explore all aspects of the subject. Despite the consolidated nature of the class, it wasn't overwhelming and the professor and TA were extremely supportive of students throughout the course.
Yes. Good grounding in the basics of biostatistics. Does require work and application to get through the material

The course gives a person basic understanding of the statistics. It will be good starting point for a student if s/he doesn't have any background about statistics. But having a health-related background will be helpful to understand the bio part: the medical examples and the logc behind that.
I would highly recommend
Definitely recommended! Both the professor and TA are excellent too!
It's a required class and gives a good foundation of statistics. You've got to take it, so I'd definitely recommend taking it with this professor.
I would highly recommend this course.
I would recommend this course as an introduction to applied statistics in the context of life sciences and healthcare.
Yes - absolutely would recommend for the reasons above.

I would highly recommend this class to all students.
The instructor was amazing and very passionate about biostatistics and really imparted an appreciate for her subject to the entire class. She was a phenomenal teacher and really explained all the concepts, from easy to difficult in the simplest way for everyone to understand.
Yes!
Great pair of teachers. Recommend but not rushed summer course.
